   8765  f457					      endif		; MOUSESUPPORT
   8766  f457
   8767  f457				   mouse0update
   8768  f457				  -	      ifconst	MOUSE0SUPPORT
   8769  f457				  -
   8770  f457				  -mousetableselect =	inttemp2
   8771  f457				  -mousexdelta =	inttemp3
   8772  f457				  -mouseydelta =	inttemp4
   8773  f457				  -lastSWCHA  =	inttemp6
   8774  f457				  -
   8775  f457				  -			; 0000YyXx st mouse
   8776  f457				  -			; 0000xyXY amiga mouse
   8777  f457				  -
   8778  f457				  -	      lda	#$ff
   8779  f457				  -	      sta	lastSWCHA
   8780  f457				  -
   8781  f457				  -	      ldy	port0control
   8782  f457				  -
   8783  f457				  -	      lda	#%00010000
   8784  f457				  -	      cpy	#9	; AMIGA?
   8785  f457				  -	      bne	skipamigabitsfix0
   8786  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   8787  f457				  -skipamigabitsfix0
   8788  f457				  -	      sta	mousetableselect
   8789  f457				  -	      ifconst	DRIVINGBOOST
   8790  f457				  -	      cpy	#6	; DRIVING?
   8791  f457				  -	      bne	skipdriving0setup
   8792  f457				  -			; swap mousex0 and mousey0. mousex seen by the 7800basic program
   8793  f457				  -			; trails the actual mousex0, so we can smoothly interpolate toward
   8794  f457				  -			; the actual position. This actual position is stored in mousey0
   8795  f457				  -			; after the driver has run.
   8796  f457				  -	      ldx	mousex0
   8797  f457				  -	      lda	mousey0
   8798  f457				  -	      stx	mousey0
   8799  f457				  -	      sta	mousex0
   8800  f457				  -skipdriving0setup
   8801  f457				  -	      endif		; DRIVINGBOOST
   8802  f457				  -
   8803  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   8804  f457				  -	      sta	mousexdelta
   8805  f457				  -	      sta	mouseydelta
   8806  f457				  -
   8807  f457				  -	      ifnconst	MOUSETIME
   8808  f457				  -	      ifnconst	MOUSEXONLY
   8809  f457				  -	      lda	#180	; minimum for x+y
   8810  f457				  -	      else
   8811  f457				  -	      lda	#100	; minimum for just x
   8812  f457				  -	      endif
   8813  f457				  -	      else
   8814  f457				  -	      lda	#MOUSETIME
   8815  f457				  -	      endif
   8816  f457				  -	      jsr	SETTIM64T	; INTIM is in Y
   8817  f457				  -
   8818  f457				  -mouse0updateloop
   8819  f457				  -	      lda	SWCHA
   8820  f457				  -	      asr	#%11110000	; Undocumented. A = A & #IMM, then LSR A.
   8821  f457				  -	      cmp	lastSWCHA
   8822  f457				  -	      beq	mouse0loopcondition
   8823  f457				  -	      sta	lastSWCHA
   8824  f457				  -	      lsr
   8825  f457				  -	      lsr
   8826  f457				  -	      lsr
   8827  f457				  -
   8828  f457				  -	      ora	mousetableselect	; atari/amiga decoding table selection
   8829  f457				  -
   8830  f457				  -			; st mice encode on different bits/joystick-lines than amiga mice...
   8831  f457				  -			; 0000YyXx st mouse
   8832  f457				  -			; 0000xyXY amiga mouse
   8833  f457				  -			; ...so can shuffle the amiga bits to reuse the st driver.
   8834  f457				  -	      tay
   8835  f457				  -	      lax	amigatoataribits,y
   8836  f457				  -
   8837  f457				  -	      ifnconst	MOUSEXONLY
   8838  f457				  -			; first the Y...
   8839  f457				  -	      and	#%00001100
   8840  f457				  -	      ora	mousecodey0
   8841  f457				  -	      tay
   8842  f457				  -	      lda	rotationalcompare,y
   8843  f457				  -	      clc
   8844  f457				  -	      adc	mouseydelta
   8845  f457				  -	      sta	mouseydelta
   8846  f457				  -	      tya
   8847  f457				  -	      lsr
   8848  f457				  -	      lsr
   8849  f457				  -	      sta	mousecodey0
   8850  f457				  -	      txa
   8851  f457				  -			; ...then the X...
   8852  f457				  -	      and	#%00000011
   8853  f457				  -	      tax
   8854  f457				  -	      endif		; !MOUSEXONLY
   8855  f457				  -
   8856  f457				  -	      asl
   8857  f457				  -	      asl
   8858  f457				  -	      ora	mousecodex0
   8859  f457				  -	      tay
   8860  f457				  -	      lda	rotationalcompare,y
   8861  f457				  -	      adc	mousexdelta	; carry was clear by previous ASL
   8862  f457				  -	      sta	mousexdelta
   8863  f457				  -	      stx	mousecodex0
   8864  f457				  -mouse0loopcondition
   8865  f457				  -	      lda	TIMINT
   8866  f457				  -	      bpl	mouse0updateloop
   8867  f457				  -
   8868  f457				  -			; *** adapt to selected device resolution.
   8869  f457				  -	      ldx	port0control
   8870  f457				  -
   8871  f457				  -	      ifconst	PRECISIONMOUSING
   8872  f457				  -	      ldy	port0resolution
   8873  f457				  -	      bne	mouse0halveddone
   8874  f457				  -	      cpx	#6	; half-resolution is no good for driving wheels
   8875  f457				  -	      beq	mouse0halveddone
   8876  f457				  -			; resolution=0 is half mouse resolution, necessary for precision
   8877  f457				  -			; mousing on a 160x240 screen with a 1000 dpi mouse.
   8878  f457				  -
   8879  f457				  -	      lda	mousexdelta
   8880  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   8881  f457				  -	      ror		; do a signed divide by 2.
   8882  f457				  -	      clc
   8883  f457				  -	      adc	mousex0
   8884  f457				  -	      sta	mousex0
   8885  f457				  -	      ifnconst	MOUSEXONLY
   8886  f457				  -	      lda	mouseydelta
   8887  f457				  -	      clc
   8888  f457				  -	      adc	mousey0
   8889  f457				  -	      sta	mousey0
   8890  f457				  -	      endif
   8891  f457				  -			; at half resolution we just exit after updating x and y
   8892  f457				  -	      jmp	LLRET0
   8893  f457				  -mouse0halveddone
   8894  f457				  -	      endif		; PRECISIONMOUSING
   8895  f457				  -
   8896  f457				  -	      ifnconst	MOUSEXONLY
   8897  f457				  -	      asl	mouseydelta	; *2 because Y resolution is finer
   8898  f457				  -	      ldy	port0resolution
   8899  f457				  -	      dey
   8900  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   8901  f457				  -mousey0resolutionfix
   8902  f457				  -	      clc
   8903  f457				  -	      adc	mouseydelta
   8904  f457				  -	      dey
   8905  f457				  -	      bpl	mousey0resolutionfix
   8906  f457				  -	      clc
   8907  f457				  -	      adc	mousey0
   8908  f457				  -	      sta	mousey0
   8909  f457				  -	      endif		; MOUSEXONLY
   8910  f457				  -
   8911  f457				  -	      ldy	port0resolution
   8912  f457				  -	      dey
   8913  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   8914  f457				  -mousex0resolutionfix
   8915  f457				  -	      clc
   8916  f457				  -	      adc	mousexdelta
   8917  f457				  -	      dey
   8918  f457				  -	      bpl	mousex0resolutionfix
   8919  f457				  -	      ifnconst	DRIVINGBOOST
   8920  f457				  -	      clc
   8921  f457				  -	      adc	mousex0
   8922  f457				  -	      sta	mousex0
   8923  f457				  -	      else
   8924  f457				  -	      cpx	#6
   8925  f457				  -	      beq	carryonmouse0boost
   8926  f457				  -	      clc
   8927  f457				  -	      adc	mousex0
   8928  f457				  -	      sta	mousex0
   8929  f457				  -	      jmp	LLRET0
   8930  f457				  -carryonmouse0boost
   8931  f457				  -	      sta	mousexdelta
   8932  f457				  -	      clc
   8933  f457				  -	      adc	mousecodey0
   8934  f457				  -	      sta	mousecodey0
   8935  f457				  -	      clc
   8936  f457				  -	      adc	mousex0
   8937  f457				  -	      tay		; save the target X
   8938  f457				  -	      adc	mousey0	; average in the smoothly-trailing X
   8939  f457				  -	      ror
   8940  f457				  -	      sta	mousex0	; mousex0 now has the smoothly trailing X
   8941  f457				  -	      sty	mousey0	; and mousey0 has the the target X
   8942  f457				  -
   8943  f457				  -			; check to see if the coordinate wrapped. If so, undo the averaging code.
   8944  f457				  -			; A has mousex0, the smoothly trailing X
   8945  f457				  -	      sbc	mousey0	; less the target X
   8946  f457				  -	      bpl	skipabsolutedrive0
   8947  f457				  -	      eor	#$ff
   8948  f457				  -skipabsolutedrive0
   8949  f457				  -	      cmp	#64	; just an unreasonably large change
   8950  f457				  -	      bcc	skipdrivewrapfix0
   8951  f457				  -	      sty	mousex0	; if X wrapped, we catch the trailing X up to the target X
   8952  f457				  -skipdrivewrapfix0
   8953  f457				  -
   8954  f457				  -			; get rid of the tweening if the distance travelled was very small
   8955  f457				  -	      lda	mousexdelta
   8956  f457				  -	      cmp	port0resolution
   8957  f457				  -	      bcs	skipbetweenfix0
   8958  f457				  -	      lda	mousex0
   8959  f457				  -	      sta	mousey0
   8960  f457				  -skipbetweenfix0
   8961  f457				  -
   8962  f457				  -drivingboostreductioncheck0
   8963  f457				  -			; The below code amounts to mousecodey0=mousecodey0-(mousecodey0/8)
   8964  f457				  -			; +ve mousecodey0 is converted to -ve to do the calculation, and then
   8965  f457				  -			; negated again because truncation during BCD math results in
   8966  f457				  -			; differing magnitudes, depending if the value is +ve or -ve.
   8967  f457				  -driving0fix
   8968  f457				  -	      lax	mousecodey0
   8969  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   8970  f457				  -	      bcs	driving0skipnegate1
   8971  f457				  -	      eor	#$FF
   8972  f457				  -	      adc	#1
   8973  f457				  -	      sta	mousecodey0
   8974  f457				  -driving0skipnegate1
   8975  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   8976  f457				  -	      ror
   8977  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   8978  f457				  -	      ror
   8979  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   8980  f457				  -	      ror
   8981  f457				  -	      sta	inttemp1
   8982  f457				  -	      lda	mousecodey0
   8983  f457				  -	      sec
   8984  f457				  -	      sbc	inttemp1
   8985  f457				  -	      cpx	#$80
   8986  f457				  -	      bcs	driving0skipnegate2
   8987  f457				  -	      eor	#$FF
   8988  f457				  -	      adc	#1
   8989  f457				  -driving0skipnegate2
   8990  f457				  -	      sta	mousecodey0
   8991  f457				  -drivingboostdone0
   8992  f457				  -	      endif		; DRIVINGBOOST
   8993  f457				  -
   8994  f457				  -	      jmp	LLRET0
   8995  f457				  -
   8996  f457					      endif		; MOUSE0SUPPORT
   8997  f457
   8998  f457				   mouse1update
   8999  f457				  -	      ifconst	MOUSE1SUPPORT
   9000  f457				  -
   9001  f457				  -mousetableselect =	inttemp2
   9002  f457				  -mousexdelta =	inttemp3
   9003  f457				  -mouseydelta =	inttemp4
   9004  f457				  -lastSWCHA  =	inttemp6
   9005  f457				  -
   9006  f457				  -			; 0000YyXx st mouse
   9007  f457				  -			; 0000xyXY amiga mouse
   9008  f457				  -
   9009  f457				  -	      lda	#$ff
   9010  f457				  -	      sta	lastSWCHA
   9011  f457				  -
   9012  f457				  -	      ldy	port1control
   9013  f457				  -
   9014  f457				  -	      lda	#%00010000
   9015  f457				  -	      cpy	#9	; AMIGA?
   9016  f457				  -	      bne	skipamigabitsfix1
   9017  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   9018  f457				  -skipamigabitsfix1
   9019  f457				  -	      sta	mousetableselect
   9020  f457				  -	      ifconst	DRIVINGBOOST
   9021  f457				  -	      cpy	#6	; DRIVING?
   9022  f457				  -	      bne	skipdriving1setup
   9023  f457				  -			; swap mousex1 and mousey1. mousex seen by the 7800basic program
   9024  f457				  -			; trails the actual mousex1, so we can smoothly interpolate toward
   9025  f457				  -			; the actual position. This actual position is stored in mousey1
   9026  f457				  -			; after the driver has run.
   9027  f457				  -	      ldx	mousex1
   9028  f457				  -	      lda	mousey1
   9029  f457				  -	      stx	mousey1
   9030  f457				  -	      sta	mousex1
   9031  f457				  -skipdriving1setup
   9032  f457				  -	      endif		; DRIVINGBOOST
   9033  f457				  -
   9034  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   9035  f457				  -	      sta	mousexdelta
   9036  f457				  -	      sta	mouseydelta
   9037  f457				  -
   9038  f457				  -	      ifnconst	MOUSETIME
   9039  f457				  -	      ifnconst	MOUSEXONLY
   9040  f457				  -	      lda	#180	; minimum for x+y
   9041  f457				  -	      else
   9042  f457				  -	      lda	#100	; minimum for just x
   9043  f457				  -	      endif
   9044  f457				  -	      else
   9045  f457				  -	      lda	#MOUSETIME
   9046  f457				  -	      endif
   9047  f457				  -	      jsr	SETTIM64T	; INTIM is in Y
   9048  f457				  -
   9049  f457				  -mouse1updateloop
   9050  f457				  -	      lda	SWCHA
   9051  f457				  -	      and	#%00001111
   9052  f457				  -	      cmp	lastSWCHA
   9053  f457				  -	      beq	mouse1loopcondition
   9054  f457				  -	      sta	lastSWCHA
   9055  f457				  -
   9056  f457				  -	      ora	mousetableselect	; atari/amiga decoding table selection
   9057  f457				  -
   9058  f457				  -			; st mice encode on different bits/joystick-lines than amiga mice...
   9059  f457				  -			; 0000YyXx st mouse
   9060  f457				  -			; 0000xyXY amiga mouse
   9061  f457				  -			; ...so can shuffle the amiga bits to reuse the st driver.
   9062  f457				  -	      tay
   9063  f457				  -	      lax	amigatoataribits,y
   9064  f457				  -
   9065  f457				  -	      ifnconst	MOUSEXONLY
   9066  f457				  -			; first the Y...
   9067  f457				  -	      and	#%00001100
   9068  f457				  -	      ora	mousecodey1
   9069  f457				  -	      tay
   9070  f457				  -	      lda	rotationalcompare,y
   9071  f457				  -	      clc
   9072  f457				  -	      adc	mouseydelta
   9073  f457				  -	      sta	mouseydelta
   9074  f457				  -	      tya
   9075  f457				  -	      lsr
   9076  f457				  -	      lsr
   9077  f457				  -	      sta	mousecodey1
   9078  f457				  -	      txa
   9079  f457				  -			; ...then the X...
   9080  f457				  -	      and	#%00000011
   9081  f457				  -	      tax
   9082  f457				  -	      endif		; !MOUSEXONLY
   9083  f457				  -
   9084  f457				  -	      asl
   9085  f457				  -	      asl
   9086  f457				  -	      ora	mousecodex1
   9087  f457				  -	      tay
   9088  f457				  -	      lda	rotationalcompare,y
   9089  f457				  -	      adc	mousexdelta	; carry was clear by previous ASL
   9090  f457				  -	      sta	mousexdelta
   9091  f457				  -	      stx	mousecodex1
   9092  f457				  -mouse1loopcondition
   9093  f457				  -	      lda	TIMINT
   9094  f457				  -	      bpl	mouse1updateloop
   9095  f457				  -
   9096  f457				  -			; *** adapt to selected device resolution.
   9097  f457				  -	      ldx	port1control
   9098  f457				  -
   9099  f457				  -	      ifconst	PRECISIONMOUSING
   9100  f457				  -	      ldy	port1resolution
   9101  f457				  -	      bne	mouse1halveddone
   9102  f457				  -	      cpx	#6	; half-resolution is no good for driving wheels
   9103  f457				  -	      beq	mouse1halveddone
   9104  f457				  -			; resolution=0 is half mouse resolution, necessary for precision
   9105  f457				  -			; mousing on a 160x240 screen with a 1000 dpi mouse.
   9106  f457				  -
   9107  f457				  -	      lda	mousexdelta
   9108  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   9109  f457				  -	      ror		; do a signed divide by 2.
   9110  f457				  -	      clc
   9111  f457				  -	      adc	mousex1
   9112  f457				  -	      sta	mousex1
   9113  f457				  -	      ifnconst	MOUSEXONLY
   9114  f457				  -	      lda	mouseydelta
   9115  f457				  -	      clc
   9116  f457				  -	      adc	mousey1
   9117  f457				  -	      sta	mousey1
   9118  f457				  -	      endif
   9119  f457				  -			; at half resolution we just exit after updating x and y
   9120  f457				  -	      jmp	LLRET1
   9121  f457				  -mouse1halveddone
   9122  f457				  -	      endif		; PRECISIONMOUSING
   9123  f457				  -
   9124  f457				  -	      ifnconst	MOUSEXONLY
   9125  f457				  -	      asl	mouseydelta	; *2 because Y resolution is finer
   9126  f457				  -	      ldy	port1resolution
   9127  f457				  -	      dey
   9128  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   9129  f457				  -mousey1resolutionfix
   9130  f457				  -	      clc
   9131  f457				  -	      adc	mouseydelta
   9132  f457				  -	      dey
   9133  f457				  -	      bpl	mousey1resolutionfix
   9134  f457				  -	      clc
   9135  f457				  -	      adc	mousey1
   9136  f457				  -	      sta	mousey1
   9137  f457				  -	      endif		; MOUSEXONLY
   9138  f457				  -
   9139  f457				  -	      ldy	port1resolution
   9140  f457				  -	      dey
   9141  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   9142  f457				  -mousex1resolutionfix
   9143  f457				  -	      clc
   9144  f457				  -	      adc	mousexdelta
   9145  f457				  -	      dey
   9146  f457				  -	      bpl	mousex1resolutionfix
   9147  f457				  -	      ifnconst	DRIVINGBOOST
   9148  f457				  -	      clc
   9149  f457				  -	      adc	mousex1
   9150  f457				  -	      sta	mousex1
   9151  f457				  -	      else
   9152  f457				  -	      cpx	#6
   9153  f457				  -	      beq	carryonmouse1boost
   9154  f457				  -	      clc
   9155  f457				  -	      adc	mousex1
   9156  f457				  -	      sta	mousex1
   9157  f457				  -	      jmp	LLRET1
   9158  f457				  -carryonmouse1boost
   9159  f457				  -	      sta	mousexdelta
   9160  f457				  -	      clc
   9161  f457				  -	      adc	mousecodey1
   9162  f457				  -	      sta	mousecodey1
   9163  f457				  -	      clc
   9164  f457				  -	      adc	mousex1
   9165  f457				  -	      tay		; save the target X
   9166  f457				  -	      adc	mousey1	; average in the smoothly-trailing X
   9167  f457				  -	      ror
   9168  f457				  -	      sta	mousex1	; mousex0 now has the smoothly trailing X
   9169  f457				  -	      sty	mousey1	; and mousey0 has the the target X
   9170  f457				  -
   9171  f457				  -			; check to see if the coordinate wrapped. If so, undo the averaging code.
   9172  f457				  -			; A has mousex1, the smoothly trailing X
   9173  f457				  -	      sbc	mousey1	; less the target X
   9174  f457				  -	      bpl	skipabsolutedrive1
   9175  f457				  -	      eor	#$ff
   9176  f457				  -skipabsolutedrive1
   9177  f457				  -	      cmp	#64	; just an unreasonably large change
   9178  f457				  -	      bcc	skipdrivewrapfix1
   9179  f457				  -	      sty	mousex1	; if X wrapped, we catch the trailing X up to the target X
   9180  f457				  -skipdrivewrapfix1
   9181  f457				  -
   9182  f457				  -			; get rid of the tweening if the distance travelled was very small
   9183  f457				  -	      lda	mousexdelta
   9184  f457				  -	      cmp	port1resolution
   9185  f457				  -	      bcs	skipbetweenfix1
   9186  f457				  -	      lda	mousex1
   9187  f457				  -	      sta	mousey1
   9188  f457				  -skipbetweenfix1
   9189  f457				  -
   9190  f457				  -drivingboostreductioncheck1
   9191  f457				  -			; The below code amounts to mousecodey0=mousecodey0-(mousecodey0/8)
   9192  f457				  -			; +ve mousecodey0 is converted to -ve to do the calculation, and then
   9193  f457				  -			; negated again because truncation during BCD math results in
   9194  f457				  -			; differing magnitudes, depending if the value is +ve or -ve.
   9195  f457				  -driving1fix
   9196  f457				  -	      lax	mousecodey1
   9197  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   9198  f457				  -	      bcs	driving0skipnegate1
   9199  f457				  -	      eor	#$FF
   9200  f457				  -	      adc	#1
   9201  f457				  -	      sta	mousecodey1
   9202  f457				  -driving0skipnegate1
   9203  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   9204  f457				  -	      ror
   9205  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   9206  f457				  -	      ror
   9207  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   9208  f457				  -	      ror
   9209  f457				  -	      sta	inttemp1
   9210  f457				  -	      lda	mousecodey1
   9211  f457				  -	      sec
   9212  f457				  -	      sbc	inttemp1
   9213  f457				  -	      cpx	#$80
   9214  f457				  -	      bcs	driving1skipnegate2
   9215  f457				  -	      eor	#$FF
   9216  f457				  -	      adc	#1
   9217  f457				  -driving1skipnegate2
   9218  f457				  -	      sta	mousecodey1
   9219  f457				  -drivingboostdone1
   9220  f457				  -	      endif		; DRIVINGBOOST
   9221  f457				  -
   9222  f457				  -	      jmp	LLRET1
   9223  f457				  -
   9224  f457					      endif		; MOUSE1SUPPORT
   9225  f457
   9226  f457
   9227  f457				   trakball0update
   9228  f457				  -	      ifconst	TRAKBALL0SUPPORT
   9229  f457				  -	      ifnconst	TRAKTIME
   9230  f457				  -	      ifnconst	TRAKXONLY
   9231  f457				  -	      lda	#180	; minimum for x+y
   9232  f457				  -	      else		; !TRAKXONLY
   9233  f457				  -	      lda	#100	; minimum for just x
   9234  f457				  -	      endif		; !TRAKXONLY
   9235  f457				  -	      else		; !TRAKTIME
   9236  f457				  -	      lda	#TRAKTIME
   9237  f457				  -	      endif		; !TRAKTIME
   9238  f457				  -	      jsr	SETTIM64T	; INTIM is in Y
   9239  f457				  -	      ldx	#0
   9240  f457				  -	      ifnconst	TRAKXONLY
   9241  f457				  -	      ldy	#0
   9242  f457				  -	      endif		; TRAKXONLY
   9243  f457				  -trakball0updateloop
   9244  f457				  -	      lda	SWCHA
   9245  f457				  -	      and	#%00110000
   9246  f457				  -	      cmp	trakballcodex0
   9247  f457				  -	      sta	trakballcodex0
   9248  f457				  -	      beq	trakball0movementXdone
   9249  f457				  -	      and	#%00010000
   9250  f457				  -	      beq	trakball0negativeX
   9251  f457				  -trakball0positiveX
   9252  f457				  -			;(2 from beq)
   9253  f457				  -	      inx		; 2
   9254  f457				  -	      jmp	trakball0movementXdone	; 3
   9255  f457				  -trakball0negativeX
   9256  f457				  -			;(3 from beq)
   9257  f457				  -	      dex		; 2
   9258  f457				  -	      nop		; 2
   9259  f457				  -trakball0movementXdone
   9260  f457				  -
   9261  f457				  -	      ifnconst	TRAKXONLY
   9262  f457				  -	      lda	SWCHA
   9263  f457				  -	      and	#%11000000
   9264  f457				  -	      cmp	trakballcodey0
   9265  f457				  -	      sta	trakballcodey0
   9266  f457				  -	      beq	trakball0movementYdone
   9267  f457				  -	      and	#%01000000
   9268  f457				  -	      beq	trakball0negativeY
   9269  f457				  -trakball0positiveY
   9270  f457				  -			;(2 from beq)
   9271  f457				  -	      iny		; 2
   9272  f457				  -	      jmp	trakball0movementYdone	; 3
   9273  f457				  -trakball0negativeY
   9274  f457				  -			;(3 from beq)
   9275  f457				  -	      dey		; 2
   9276  f457				  -	      nop		; 2
   9277  f457				  -trakball0movementYdone
   9278  f457				  -	      endif		; !TRAKXONLY
   9279  f457				  -
   9280  f457				  -	      lda	TIMINT
   9281  f457				  -	      bpl	trakball0updateloop
   9282  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   9283  f457				  -	      cpx	#0
   9284  f457				  -	      beq	trakball0skipXadjust
   9285  f457				  -	      clc
   9286  f457				  -trakball0Xloop
   9287  f457				  -	      adc	port0resolution
   9288  f457				  -	      dex
   9289  f457				  -	      bne	trakball0Xloop
   9290  f457				  -	      clc
   9291  f457				  -	      adc	trakballx0
   9292  f457				  -	      sta	trakballx0
   9293  f457				  -trakball0skipXadjust
   9294  f457				  -	      ifnconst	TRAKXONLY
   9295  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   9296  f457				  -	      cpy	#0
   9297  f457				  -	      beq	trakball0skipYadjust
   9298  f457				  -	      clc
   9299  f457				  -trakball0yloop
   9300  f457				  -	      adc	port0resolution
   9301  f457				  -	      dey
   9302  f457				  -	      bne	trakball0yloop
   9303  f457				  -	      clc
   9304  f457				  -	      adc	trakbally0
   9305  f457				  -	      sta	trakbally0
   9306  f457				  -trakball0skipYadjust
   9307  f457				  -	      endif		; !TRAKXONLY
   9308  f457				  -
   9309  f457				  -	      jmp	LLRET0
   9310  f457					      endif
   9311  f457
   9312  f457
   9313  f457
   9314  f457				   trakball1update
   9315  f457				  -	      ifconst	TRAKBALL1SUPPORT
   9316  f457				  -	      ifnconst	TRAKTIME
   9317  f457				  -	      ifnconst	TRAKXONLY
   9318  f457				  -	      lda	#180	; minimum for x+y
   9319  f457				  -	      else		; !TRAKXONLY
   9320  f457				  -	      lda	#100	; minimum for just x
   9321  f457				  -	      endif		; !TRAKXONLY
   9322  f457				  -	      else		; !TRAKTIME
   9323  f457				  -	      lda	#TRAKTIME
   9324  f457				  -	      endif		; !TRAKTIME
   9325  f457				  -	      jsr	SETTIM64T	; INTIM is in Y
   9326  f457				  -	      ldx	#0
   9327  f457				  -	      ifnconst	TRAKXONLY
   9328  f457				  -	      ldy	#0
   9329  f457				  -	      endif		; TRAKXONLY
   9330  f457				  -trakball1updateloop
   9331  f457				  -	      lda	SWCHA
   9332  f457				  -	      and	#%00000011
   9333  f457				  -	      cmp	trakballcodex1
   9334  f457				  -	      sta	trakballcodex1
   9335  f457				  -	      beq	trakball1movementXdone
   9336  f457				  -	      and	#%00000001
   9337  f457				  -	      beq	trakball1negativeX
   9338  f457				  -trakball1positiveX
   9339  f457				  -			;(2 from beq)
   9340  f457				  -	      inx		; 2
   9341  f457				  -	      jmp	trakball1movementXdone	; 3
   9342  f457				  -trakball1negativeX
   9343  f457				  -			;(3 from beq)
   9344  f457				  -	      dex		; 2
   9345  f457				  -	      nop		; 2
   9346  f457				  -trakball1movementXdone
   9347  f457				  -
   9348  f457				  -	      ifnconst	TRAKXONLY
   9349  f457				  -	      lda	SWCHA
   9350  f457				  -	      and	#%00001100
   9351  f457				  -	      cmp	trakballcodey1
   9352  f457				  -	      sta	trakballcodey1
   9353  f457				  -	      beq	trakball1movementYdone
   9354  f457				  -	      and	#%00000100
   9355  f457				  -	      beq	trakball1negativeY
   9356  f457				  -trakball1positiveY
   9357  f457				  -			;(2 from beq)
   9358  f457				  -	      iny		; 2
   9359  f457				  -	      jmp	trakball1movementYdone	; 3
   9360  f457				  -trakball1negativeY
   9361  f457				  -			;(3 from beq)
   9362  f457				  -	      dey		; 2
   9363  f457				  -	      nop		; 2
   9364  f457				  -trakball1movementYdone
   9365  f457				  -	      endif		; !TRAKXONLY
   9366  f457				  -
   9367  f457				  -	      lda	TIMINT
   9368  f457				  -	      bpl	trakball1updateloop
   9369  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   9370  f457				  -	      cpx	#0
   9371  f457				  -	      beq	trakball1skipXadjust
   9372  f457				  -	      clc
   9373  f457				  -trakball1Xloop
   9374  f457				  -	      adc	port1resolution
   9375  f457				  -	      dex
   9376  f457				  -	      bne	trakball1Xloop
   9377  f457				  -	      clc
   9378  f457				  -	      adc	trakballx1
   9379  f457				  -	      sta	trakballx1
   9380  f457				  -trakball1skipXadjust
   9381  f457				  -	      ifnconst	TRAKXONLY
   9382  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   9383  f457				  -	      cpy	#0
   9384  f457				  -	      beq	trakball1skipYadjust
   9385  f457				  -	      clc
   9386  f457				  -trakball1yloop
   9387  f457				  -	      adc	port1resolution
   9388  f457				  -	      dey

   9397  f457					      endif

   9399  f457
   9400  f457				   paddleport0update
   9401  f457				  -	      ifconst	PADDLE0SUPPORT
   9402  f457				  -	      lda	#6
   9403  f457				  -	      sta	VBLANK	; start charging the paddle caps
   9404  f457				  -	      lda	#0	; use PADDLE timing
   9405  f457				  -	      jsr	SETTIM64T	; INTIM is in Y
   9406  f457				  -
   9407  f457				  -paddleport0updateloop
   9408  f457				  -	      lda	INPT0
   9409  f457				  -	      bmi	skippaddle0setposition
   9410  f457				  -	      sty	paddleposition0
   9411  f457				  -skippaddle0setposition
   9412  f457				  -	      ifconst	TWOPADDLESUPPORT
   9413  f457				  -	      lda	INPT1
   9414  f457				  -	      bmi	skippaddle1setposition
   9415  f457				  -	      sty	paddleposition1
   9416  f457				  -skippaddle1setposition
   9417  f457				  -	      endif
   9418  f457				  -	      ldy	INTIM
   9419  f457				  -	      cpy	#TIMEOFFSET
   9420  f457				  -	      bcs	paddleport0updateloop
   9421  f457				  -
   9422  f457				  -	      lda	#%10000110
   9423  f457				  -	      sta	VBLANK	; dump paddles to ground... this may not be great for genesis controllers
   9424  f457				  -	      sec
   9425  f457				  -	      lda	paddleposition0
   9426  f457				  -	      sbc	#TIMEOFFSET
   9427  f457				  -	      ifconst	PADDLESCALEX2
   9428  f457				  -	      asl
   9429  f457				  -	      endif
   9430  f457				  -
   9431  f457				  -	      ifnconst	PADDLESMOOTHINGOFF

   9433  f457				  -	      adc	paddleprevious0
   9434  f457				  -	      ror
   9435  f457				  -	      sta	paddleprevious0
   9436  f457				  -	      endif
   9437  f457				  -
   9438  f457				  -	      sta	paddleposition0
   9439  f457				  -
   9440  f457				  -	      ifconst	TWOPADDLESUPPORT
   9441  f457				  -	      sec
   9442  f457				  -	      lda	paddleposition1
   9443  f457				  -	      sbc	#TIMEOFFSET
   9444  f457				  -	      ifconst	PADDLESCALEX2
   9445  f457				  -	      asl
   9446  f457				  -	      endif
   9447  f457				  -
   9448  f457				  -	      ifnconst	PADDLESMOOTHINGOFF
   9449  f457				  -	      clc
   9450  f457				  -	      adc	paddleprevious1
   9451  f457				  -	      ror
   9452  f457				  -	      sta	paddleprevious1
   9453  f457				  -	      endif

   9455  f457				  -	      endif		; TWOPADDLESUPPORT
   9456  f457				  -

   9458  f457					      endif

   9520  f457
   9521  f457
   9522  f457				   paddlebuttonhandler		; outside of conditional, for button-handler LUT
   9523  f457				  -	      ifconst	PADDLESUPPORT
   9524  f457				  -			; x=0|1 for port, rather than paddle #.
   9525  f457				  -			; Only the first paddle button will integrate into "joy0fire" testing. If the
   9526  f457				  -			; game wants to support 2 paddles, up to the game to instead test the
   9527  f457				  -			; joystick right+left directions instead.
   9528  f457				  -	      lda	SWCHA	; top of nibble is first paddle button
   9529  f457				  -	      cpx	#0	; port 0?
   9530  f457				  -	      beq	skippaddleport2shift
   9531  f457				  -	      asl		; shift second port to upper nibble
   9532  f457				  -	      asl
   9533  f457				  -	      asl
   9534  f457				  -	      asl
   9535  f457				  -skippaddleport2shift
   9536  f457				  -	      and	#%11000000
   9537  f457				  -	      eor	#%11000000	; invert
   9538  f457				  -	      sta	sINPT1,x
   9539  f457				  -	      jmp	buttonreadloopreturn
   9540  f457					      endif		; PADDLESUPPORT
   9541  f457
   9542  f457				   mousebuttonhandler		; outside of conditional, for button-handler LUT
   9543  f457				  -	      ifconst	MOUSESUPPORT
   9544  f457				  -			; stick the mouse buttons in the correct shadow register...
   9545  f457				  -	      txa
   9546  f457				  -	      asl
   9547  f457				  -	      tay		; y=x*2
   9548  f457				  -	      lda	INPT4,x
   9549  f457				  -	      eor	#%10000000
   9550  f457				  -	      lsr
   9551  f457				  -	      sta	sINPT1,x
   9552  f457				  -
   9553  f457				  -	      lda	INPT1,y
   9554  f457				  -	      and	#%10000000
   9555  f457				  -	      eor	#%10000000
   9556  f457				  -	      ora	sINPT1,x
   9557  f457				  -	      sta	sINPT1,x
   9558  f457				  -	      jmp	buttonreadloopreturn
   9559  f457					      endif		; MOUSESUPPORT
   9560  f457
   9561  f457				  -	      ifconst	KEYPADSUPPORT
   9562  f457				  -			; ** select keypad rows 0 to 3 over 4 frames...
   9563  f457				  -keypadrowselect
   9564  f457				  -	      inc	keypadcounter
   9565  f457				  -	      ldy	#0
   9566  f457				  -	      lda	port0control
   9567  f457				  -	      cmp	#7
   9568  f457				  -	      bne	skipport0val
   9569  f457				  -	      iny		; y=y+1
   9570  f457				  -skipport0val
   9571  f457				  -	      lda	port1control
   9572  f457				  -	      cmp	#7
   9573  f457				  -	      bne	skipport1val
   9574  f457				  -	      iny
   9575  f457				  -	      iny		; y=y+2
   9576  f457				  -skipport1val
   9577  f457				  -	      cpy	#0
   9578  f457				  -	      beq	exitkeypadrowselect
   9579  f457				  -	      lda	keyrowdirectionmask,y
   9580  f457				  -	      sta	CTLSWA
   9581  f457				  -	      tya
   9582  f457				  -	      asl
   9583  f457				  -	      asl
   9584  f457				  -	      sta	inttemp1
   9585  f457				  -	      lda	keypadcounter
   9586  f457				  -	      and	#3
   9587  f457				  -	      ora	inttemp1
   9588  f457				  -	      tax
   9589  f457				  -	      lda	keyrowselectvalue,x
   9590  f457				  -	      sta	SWCHA
   9591  f457				  -exitkeypadrowselect
   9592  f457				  -	      rts
   9593  f457				  -
   9594  f457				  -keyrowdirectionmask
   9595  f457				  -	      .byte	#%00000000	; 0 : port0=input port1=input
   9596  f457				  -	      .byte	#%11110000	; 1 : port0=output port1=input
   9597  f457				  -	      .byte	#%00001111	; 2 : port0=input port1=output
   9598  f457				  -	      .byte	#%11111111	; 3 : port0=output port1=output
   9599  f457				  -
   9600  f457				  -keyrowselectvalue
   9601  f457				  -	      .byte	#%00000000, #%00000000, #%00000000, #%00000000	; no row selected, all pins high, always
   9602  f457				  -	      .byte	#%11100000, #%11010000, #%10110000, #%01110000	; p0 keypad in
   9603  f457				  -	      .byte	#%00001110, #%00001101, #%00001011, #%00000111	; p1 keypad in
   9604  f457				  -	      .byte	#%11101110, #%11011101, #%10111011, #%01110111	; p0+p1 keypads in
   9605  f457					      endif		; KEYPADSUPPORT
   9606  f457
   9607  f457				  -	      ifconst	KEYPADSUPPORT
   9608  f457				  -			; TODO - split into compile-time KEYPAD0SUPPORT and KEYPAD1SUPPORT
   9609  f457				  -keypadcolumnread
   9610  f457				  -	      lda	port0control
   9611  f457				  -	      cmp	#7
   9612  f457				  -	      bne	skipkeypadcolumnread0
   9613  f457				  -	      lda	keypadcounter
   9614  f457				  -	      and	#3
   9615  f457				  -	      asl		; x2 because keypad variables are interleaved
   9616  f457				  -	      tax
   9617  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   9618  f457				  -	      sta	keypadmatrix0a,x
   9619  f457				  -	      lda	INPT0
   9620  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   9621  f457				  -	      rol	keypadmatrix0a,x
   9622  f457				  -	      lda	INPT1
   9623  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   9624  f457				  -	      rol	keypadmatrix0a,x
   9625  f457				  -	      lda	INPT4
   9626  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   9627  f457				  -	      rol	keypadmatrix0a,x
   9628  f457				  -	      lda	keypadmatrix0a,x
   9629  f457				  -	      eor	#%00000111
   9630  f457				  -	      sta	keypadmatrix0a,x
   9631  f457				  -skipkeypadcolumnread0
   9632  f457				  -
   9633  f457				  -	      lda	port1control
   9634  f457				  -	      cmp	#7
   9635  f457				  -	      bne	skipkeypadcolumnread1
   9636  f457				  -	      lda	keypadcounter
   9637  f457				  -	      and	#3
   9638  f457				  -	      asl		; x2 because keypad variables are interleaved
   9639  f457				  -	      tax
   9640  f457				  -	      lda	#0
   9641  f457				  -	      sta	keypadmatrix1a,x
   9642  f457				  -	      rol	keypadmatrix1a,x
   9643  f457				  -	      lda	INPT2
   9644  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   9645  f457				  -	      rol	keypadmatrix1a,x
   9646  f457				  -	      lda	INPT3
   9647  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   9648  f457				  -	      rol	keypadmatrix1a,x
   9649  f457				  -	      lda	INPT5
   9650  f457				  -	      cmp	#$80
   9651  f457				  -	      rol	keypadmatrix1a,x
   9652  f457				  -	      lda	keypadmatrix1a,x
   9653  f457				  -	      eor	#%00000111
   9654  f457				  -	      sta	keypadmatrix1a,x
   9655  f457				  -skipkeypadcolumnread1
   9656  f457				  -	      rts
   9657  f457					      endif		; KEYPADSUPPORT
   9658  f457
   9659  f457				   setportforinput
   9660  f457		       ad 81 02 	      lda	CTLSWA
   9661  f45a		       3d c2 f1 	      and	SWCHA_DIRMASK,x
   9662  f45d		       8d 81 02 	      sta	CTLSWA
   9663  f460		       60		      rts
   9664  f461
   9665  f461				   setonebuttonmode
   9666  f461		       a9 06		      lda	#6	; in case we're in unlocked-bios mode
   9667  f463		       85 01		      sta	VBLANK	; if we were on paddles, the line is grounded out.
   9668  f465		       a9 14		      lda	#$14
   9669  f467		       8d 83 02 	      sta	CTLSWB
   9670  f46a		       ad 82 02 	      lda	SWCHB
   9671  f46d		       1d 87 f4 	      ora	thisjoy2buttonbit,x	; disable: write 1 to the 2-button bit
   9672  f470		       8d 82 02 	      sta	SWCHB
   9673  f473		       60		      rts
   9674  f474
   9675  f474				   settwobuttonmode
   9676  f474		       a9 06		      lda	#6	; in case we're in unlocked-bios mode
   9677  f476		       85 01		      sta	VBLANK	; if we were on paddles, the line is grounded out.
   9678  f478		       a9 14		      lda	#$14
   9679  f47a		       8d 83 02 	      sta	CTLSWB
   9680  f47d		       ad 82 02 	      lda	SWCHB
   9681  f480		       3d 88 f4 	      and	thisjoy2buttonbit+1,x	; enable: write 0 to the 2-button bit
   9682  f483		       8d 82 02 	      sta	SWCHB
   9683  f486		       60		      rts
   9684  f487
   9685  f487				   thisjoy2buttonbit
   9686  f487							; p0	p1   p0
   9687  f487		       04 10 04 	      .byte.b	$04, $10, $04
   9688  f48a
   9689  f48a				  -	      ifconst	CHANGEDMAHOLES
   9690  f48a				  -removedmaholes
   9691  f48a				  -	      ldx	#0
   9692  f48a				  -removedllholesloop
   9693  f48a				  -	      lda	DLLMEM,x
   9694  f48a				  -	      and	#%10001111
   9695  f48a				  -	      sta	DLLMEM,x
   9696  f48a				  -	      ifconst	DOUBLEBUFFER
   9697  f48a				  -	      sta	DLLMEM+DBOFFSET,x
   9698  f48a				  -	      endif
   9699  f48a				  -	      inx
   9700  f48a				  -	      inx
   9701  f48a				  -	      inx
   9702  f48a				  -	      ifconst	DOUBLEBUFFER
   9703  f48a				  -	      cpx	#DBOFFSET
   9704  f48a				  -	      bcc	removedllholesloop
   9705  f48a				  -	      else
   9706  f48a				  -	      bpl	removedllholesloop
   9707  f48a				  -	      endif
   9708  f48a				  -	      rts
   9709  f48a				  -
   9710  f48a				  -createdmaholes
   9711  f48a				  -	      ldx	#0
   9712  f48a				  -createdllholesloop
   9713  f48a				  -	      lda	DLLMEM,x
   9714  f48a				  -	      ora	#(WZONEHEIGHT*4)
   9715  f48a				  -	      sta	DLLMEM,x
   9716  f48a				  -	      ifconst	DOUBLEBUFFER
   9717  f48a				  -	      sta	DLLMEM+DBOFFSET,x
   9718  f48a				  -	      endif
   9719  f48a				  -	      inx
   9720  f48a				  -	      inx
   9721  f48a				  -	      inx
   9722  f48a				  -	      ifconst	DOUBLEBUFFER
   9723  f48a				  -	      cpx	#DBOFFSET
   9724  f48a				  -	      bcc	createdllholesloop
   9725  f48a				  -	      else
   9726  f48a				  -	      bpl	createdllholesloop
   9727  f48a				  -	      endif
   9728  f48a				  -	      rts
   9729  f48a					      endif
   9730  f48a
   9731  f48a							; Provided under the CC0 license. See the included LICENSE.txt for details.
   9732  f48a
   9733  f48a				   START
   9734  f48a				   start
   9735  f48a
   9736  f48a							;******** more or less the Atari recommended startup procedure
   9737  f48a
   9738  f48a		       78		      sei
   9739  f48b		       d8		      cld
   9740  f48c
   9741  f48c					      ifnconst	NOTIALOCK
   9742  f48c		       a9 07		      lda	#$07
   9743  f48e				  -	      else
   9744  f48e				  -	      lda	#$06
   9745  f48e					      endif
   9746  f48e		       85 01		      sta	INPTCTRL	;lock 7800 into 7800 mode
   9747  f490		       a9 7f		      lda	#$7F
   9748  f492		       85 3c		      sta	CTRL	;disable DMA
   9749  f494		       a9 00		      lda	#$00
   9750  f496		       85 38		      sta	OFFSET
   9751  f498					      ifnconst	NOTIALOCK
   9752  f498		       85 01		      sta	INPTCTRL
   9753  f49a		       85 20		      sta	BACKGRND	; black default, in case a flash cart is using something else
   9754  f49c					      endif
   9755  f49c		       a2 ff		      ldx	#$FF
   9756  f49e		       9a		      txs
   9757  f49f
   9758  f49f							;************** Clear Memory
   9759  f49f
   9760  f49f							; ** Clear 1800-27FF, pg0+pg1 memory.
   9761  f49f				   ClearMemPages
   9762  f49f		       a9 00		      lda	#0
   9763  f4a1		       a8		      tay		; y=0
   9764  f4a2		       85 80		      sta	$80
   9765  f4a4		       a2 18		      ldx	#$18
   9766  f4a6				   ClearMemPagesLoop
   9767  f4a6		       86 81		      stx	$81	; needed for when we step on ZP memory
   9768  f4a8		       91 80		      sta	($80),y	;Store data
   9769  f4aa		       c8		      iny		;Next byte
   9770  f4ab		       d0 f9		      bne	ClearMemPagesLoop
   9771  f4ad		       e8		      inx
   9772  f4ae		       e0 28		      cpx	#$28
   9773  f4b0		       d0 f4		      bne	ClearMemPagesLoop
   9774  f4b2		       85 81		      sta	$81
   9775  f4b4
   9776  f4b4							;seed random number with hopefully-random timer value
   9777  f4b4		       a9 01		      lda	#1
   9778  f4b6		       0d 84 02 	      ora	INTIM
   9779  f4b9		       85 40		      sta	rand
   9780  f4bb
   9781  f4bb							; detect the console type...
   9782  f4bb				   pndetectvblankstart
   9783  f4bb		       a5 28		      lda	MSTAT
   9784  f4bd		       10 fc		      bpl	pndetectvblankstart	; if we're not in VBLANK, wait for it to start
   9785  f4bf				   pndetectvblankover
   9786  f4bf		       a5 28		      lda	MSTAT
   9787  f4c1		       30 fc		      bmi	pndetectvblankover	; then wait for it to be over
   9788  f4c3		       a0 00		      ldy	#$00
   9789  f4c5		       a2 00		      ldx	#$00
   9790  f4c7				   pndetectvblankhappening
   9791  f4c7		       a5 28		      lda	MSTAT
   9792  f4c9		       30 07		      bmi	pndetectinvblank	; if VBLANK starts, exit our counting loop
   9793  f4cb		       85 24		      sta	WSYNC
   9794  f4cd		       85 24		      sta	WSYNC
   9795  f4cf		       e8		      inx
   9796  f4d0		       d0 f5		      bne	pndetectvblankhappening
   9797  f4d2				   pndetectinvblank
   9798  f4d2		       e0 7d		      cpx	#125
   9799  f4d4		       90 02		      bcc	pndetecispal
   9800  f4d6		       a0 01		      ldy	#$01
   9801  f4d8				   pndetecispal
   9802  f4d8		       8c 09 21 	      sty	paldetected
   9803  f4db
   9804  f4db		       20 eb f3 	      jsr	createallgamedlls
   9805  f4de
   9806  f4de		       a9 18		      lda	#>DLLMEM
   9807  f4e0		       85 2c		      sta	DPPH
   9808  f4e2		       a9 00		      lda	#<DLLMEM
   9809  f4e4		       85 30		      sta	DPPL
   9810  f4e6
   9811  f4e6				  -	      ifconst	pokeysupport
   9812  f4e6				  -			; pokey support is compiled in, so try to detect it...
   9813  f4e6				  -	      jsr	detectpokeylocation
   9814  f4e6					      endif
   9815  f4e6
   9816  f4e6		       a9 01		      lda	#1	; default for port 0 and 1 is a regular joystick
   9817  f4e8		       8d b8 01 	      sta	port0control
   9818  f4eb		       8d b9 01 	      sta	port1control
   9819  f4ee
   9820  f4ee							;Setup port A to read mode
   9821  f4ee							;lda #$00
   9822  f4ee							;sta SWCHA
   9823  f4ee							;sta CTLSWA
   9824  f4ee
   9825  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	HSSUPPORT
   9826  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	bankswitchmode
   9827  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	included.hiscore.asm.bank
   9828  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	MCPDEVCART
   9829  f4ee				  -	      lda	#($18 | included.hiscore.asm.bank)
   9830  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	dumpbankswitch
   9831  f4ee				  -	      sta	dumpbankswitch
   9832  f4ee				  -	      endif
   9833  f4ee				  -	      sta	$3000
   9834  f4ee				  -	      else
   9835  f4ee				  -	      lda	#(included.hiscore.asm.bank)
   9836  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	dumpbankswitch
   9837  f4ee				  -	      sta	dumpbankswitch
   9838  f4ee				  -	      endif
   9839  f4ee				  -	      sta	$8000
   9840  f4ee				  -	      endif
   9841  f4ee				  -	      endif		; included.hiscore.asm.bank
   9842  f4ee				  -	      endif		; bankswitchmode
   9843  f4ee				  -			; try to detect HSC
   9844  f4ee				  -	      jsr	detecthsc
   9845  f4ee				  -	      and	#1
   9846  f4ee				  -	      sta	hsdevice
   9847  f4ee				  -skipHSCdetect
   9848  f4ee				  -			; try to detect AtariVox eeprom
   9849  f4ee				  -	      jsr	detectatarivoxeeprom
   9850  f4ee				  -	      and	#2
   9851  f4ee				  -	      ora	hsdevice
   9852  f4ee				  -	      cmp	#3
   9853  f4ee				  -	      bne	storeAinhsdevice
   9854  f4ee				  -			; For now, we tie break by giving HSC priority over AtariVox.
   9855  f4ee				  -			; Later we should check each device's priority byte if set, instead,
   9856  f4ee				  -	      lda	#2
   9857  f4ee				  -storeAinhsdevice
   9858  f4ee				  -	      sta	hsdevice
   9859  f4ee				  -	      lda	#$ff
   9860  f4ee				  -	      sta	hsdifficulty
   9861  f4ee				  -	      sta	hsgameslot
   9862  f4ee				  -	      sta	hsnewscoreline
   9863  f4ee					      endif		; HSSUPPORT
   9864  f4ee
   9865  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	AVOXVOICE
   9866  f4ee				  -	      jsr	silenceavoxvoice
   9867  f4ee					      endif
   9868  f4ee
   9869  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	MULTIBUTTON
   9870  f4ee				  -	      ifnconst	HSSUPPORT
   9871  f4ee				  -min_detectatarivoxeeprom
   9872  f4ee				  -	      jsr	i2c_startwrite
   9873  f4ee				  -	      bcc	min_no_eeprom_error
   9874  f4ee				  -	      lda	#$ff
   9875  f4ee				  -	      jmp	min_avoxdetect_done
   9876  f4ee				  -min_no_eeprom_error
   9877  f4ee				  -	      lda	#$30
   9878  f4ee				  -	      jsr	i2c_txbyte
   9879  f4ee				  -	      lda	#$00
   9880  f4ee				  -	      jsr	i2c_txbyte
   9881  f4ee				  -	      jsr	i2c_stopwrite
   9882  f4ee				  -min_avoxdetect_done
   9883  f4ee				  -	      eor	#$FF
   9884  f4ee				  -	      sta	avoxdetected
   9885  f4ee				  -	      jmp	min_detectatarivoxeepromdone
   9886  f4ee				  -	      include	"i2c7800.inc"
   9887  f4ee				  -	      I2C_SUBS	temp9
   9888  f4ee				  -min_detectatarivoxeepromdone
   9889  f4ee				  -	      endif		; HSSUPPORT
   9890  f4ee					      endif		; MULTIBUTTON
   9891  f4ee
   9892  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	MULTIBUTTON
   9893  f4ee				  -	      lda	avoxdetected
   9894  f4ee				  -	      beq	skipassignavox
   9895  f4ee				  -	      lda	#10
   9896  f4ee				  -	      sta	port1control	; designate port 1 as atarivox so multibutton won't disturb it.
   9897  f4ee				  -skipassignavox
   9898  f4ee					      endif		; MULTIBUTTON
   9899  f4ee
   9900  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	RMT
   9901  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	RMTVOLUME
   9902  f4ee				  -	      lda	#$F0	; default to full RMT volume
   9903  f4ee				  -	      sta	rmtvolume
   9904  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	TIAVOLUME
   9905  f4ee				  -	      sta	tiavolume
   9906  f4ee				  -	      endif		; TIAVOLUME
   9907  f4ee				  -	      endif		; RMTVOLUME
   9908  f4ee					      else		; !RMT
   9909  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	TIAVOLUME
   9910  f4ee				  -	      lda	#$F0	; default to full TIA volume
   9911  f4ee				  -	      sta	tiavolume
   9912  f4ee					      endif		; TIAVOLUME
   9913  f4ee					      endif		; RMT
   9914  f4ee
   9915  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	bankswitchmode
   9916  f4ee				  -			; we need to switch to the first bank as a default. this needs to
   9917  f4ee				  -			; happen before DMA, in case there's a topscreenroutine in bank 0
   9918  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	MCPDEVCART
   9919  f4ee				  -	      lda	#$18	; xxx11nnn - switch to bank 0
   9920  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	dumpbankswitch
   9921  f4ee				  -	      sta	dumpbankswitch
   9922  f4ee				  -	      endif
   9923  f4ee				  -	      sta	$3000
   9924  f4ee				  -	      else
   9925  f4ee				  -	      lda	#0
   9926  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	dumpbankswitch
   9927  f4ee				  -	      sta	dumpbankswitch
   9928  f4ee				  -	      endif
   9929  f4ee				  -	      sta	$8000
   9930  f4ee				  -	      endif
   9931  f4ee					      endif
   9932  f4ee
   9933  f4ee							; CTRL 76543210
   9934  f4ee							; 7 colorburst kill
   9935  f4ee							; 6,5 dma ctrl 2=normal DMA, 3=no DMA
   9936  f4ee							; 4 character width 1=2 byte chars, 0=1 byte chars
   9937  f4ee							; 3 border control 0=background color border, 1=black border
   9938  f4ee							; 2 kangaroo mode 0=transparency, 1=kangaroo
   9939  f4ee							; 1,0 read mode 0=160x2/160x4 1=N/A 2=320B/320D 3=320A/320C
   9940  f4ee
   9941  f4ee				  -	      ifconst	DOUBLEWIDE
   9942  f4ee				  -	      lda	#%01010000	;Enable DMA, mode=160x2/160x4, 2x character width
   9943  f4ee					      else
   9944  f4ee		       a9 40		      lda	#%01000000	;Enable DMA, mode=160x2/160x4
   9945  f4f0					      endif
   9946  f4f0
   9947  f4f0		       20 4e f4 	      jsr	waitforvblankstart	; give the some vblank time to minimally update the display
   9948  f4f3
   9949  f4f3		       85 3c		      sta	CTRL
   9950  f4f5		       8d 07 21 	      sta	sCTRL
   9951  f4f8
   9952  f4f8		       20 de f3 	      jsr	vblankresync
   9953  f4fb
   9954  f4fb		       a2 01		      ldx	#1
   9955  f4fd		       20 74 f4 	      jsr	settwobuttonmode
   9956  f500		       a2 00		      ldx	#0
   9957  f502		       20 74 f4 	      jsr	settwobuttonmode
   9958  f505
   9959  f505					      ifnconst	.altgamestart
   9960  f505		       4c 00 80 	      jmp	game
   9961  f508				  -	      else
   9962  f508				  -	      jmp	.altgamestart
   9963  f508					      endif
   9964  f508
   9965  f508							; Provided under the CC0 license. See the included LICENSE.txt for details.
   9966  f508
   9967  f508							; A tunable parameter, to claim some memory back from DL usage
   9968  f508		       00 00	   MEMSKIP    =	$00
   9969  f508
   9970  f508							;************** Setup DLL entries
   9971  f508
   9972  f508							; setup some working definitions, to avoid ifnconst mess elsewhere...
   9973  f508					      ifnconst	SCREENHEIGHT
   9974  f508		       00 c0	   WSCREENHEIGHT =	192
   9975  f508				  -	      else
   9976  f508				  -WSCREENHEIGHT =	SCREENHEIGHT
   9977  f508					      endif
   9978  f508
   9979  f508				  -	      ifnconst	ZONEHEIGHT
   9980  f508				  -WZONEHEIGHT =	16
   9981  f508					      else
   9982  f508		       00 10	   WZONEHEIGHT =	ZONEHEIGHT
   9983  f508					      endif
   9984  f508
   9985  f508					      ifnconst	ZONECOUNT
   9986  f508				  -	      ifconst	VSCROLL
   9987  f508				  -WZONECOUNT =	((WSCREENHEIGHT/WZONEHEIGHT)+1)
   9988  f508					      else		; !VSCROLL
   9989  f508		       00 0c	   WZONECOUNT =	(WSCREENHEIGHT/WZONEHEIGHT)
   9990  f508					      endif		; !VSCROLL
   9991  f508				  -	      else
   9992  f508				  -	      ifconst	VSCROLL
   9993  f508				  -WZONECOUNT =	(ZONECOUNT+1)
   9994  f508				  -	      else		; !VSCROLL
   9995  f508				  -WZONECOUNT =	ZONECOUNT
   9996  f508				  -	      endif		; !VSCROLL
   9997  f508					      endif
   9998  f508
   9999  f508							; top of the frame, non-visible lines. this is based on NTSC,
  10000  f508							; but we add in extra NV lines at the end of the display to ensure
  10001  f508							; our PAL friends can play the game without it crashing.
  10002  f508		       00 19	   NVLINES    =	((243-WSCREENHEIGHT)/2)
  10003  f508
  10004  f508					      ifnconst	DLMEMSTART
  10005  f508					      ifnconst	DOUBLEBUFFER
  10006  f508				   WDLMEMSTART SET	$1880
  10007  f508				  -	      else
  10008  f508				  -WDLMEMSTART SET	$18E0
  10009  f508					      endif		; DOUBLEBUFFER
  10010  f508				  -	      else
  10011  f508				  -WDLMEMSTART SET	DLMEMSTART
  10012  f508					      endif
  10013  f508
  10014  f508				  -	      if	MEMSKIP > 0
  10015  f508				  -	      echo	"   ",[WDLMEMSTART],"to",[WDLMEMSTART+MEMSKIP-1],"was freed for game usage with MEMSKIP."
  10016  f508				  -WDLMEMSTART SET	(WDLMEMSTART + MEMSKIP)
  10017  f508					      endif		; MEMSKIP > 0
  10018  f508
  10019  f508					      ifnconst	DLMEMEND
  10020  f508				  -	      ifconst	EXTRADLMEMORY
  10021  f508				  -WDLMEMEND  =	$23FF
  10022  f508					      else
  10023  f508		       1f ff	   WDLMEMEND  =	$1FFF
  10024  f508					      endif
  10025  f508				  -	      else
  10026  f508				  -WDLMEMEND  =	DLMEMEND
  10027  f508					      endif
  10028  f508
  10029  f508
  10030  f508				   WMEMSIZE   SET	(WDLMEMEND-WDLMEMSTART+1)
  10031  f508
  10032  f508				  -	      ifconst	VSCROLL
  10033  f508				  -	      ifnconst	DOUBLEBUFFER
  10034  f508				  -			; give the last zone extra ram for the dma mask objects...
  10035  f508				  -WMEMSIZE   SET	(WMEMSIZE-(maskscrollspriteend-maskscrollsprite))
  10036  f508				  -	      endif		; DOUBLEBUFFER
  10037  f508					      endif		; VSCROLL
  10038  f508
  10039  f508					      ifnconst	DOUBLEBUFFER
  10040  f508		       00 9b	   DLLASTOBJ  =	((((WMEMSIZE/WZONECOUNT)-2)/5)*5)	; -2 to always ensure we have 1x double-byte terminator
  10041  f508				  -	      else
  10042  f508				  -DLLASTOBJ  =	((((WMEMSIZE/WZONECOUNT)-4)/10)*5)	; -4 to always ensure we have 2x double-byte terminators
  10043  f508					      endif
  10044  f508
  10045  f508		       00 9d	   TDOUBLEBUFFEROFFSET =	(DLLASTOBJ+2)	; offset between DL buffers. ie. half the real DL
  10046  f508				  -	      if	TDOUBLEBUFFEROFFSET > 255
  10047  f508				  -DOUBLEBUFFEROFFSET =	255
  10048  f508					      else
  10049  f508		       00 9d	   DOUBLEBUFFEROFFSET =	(DLLASTOBJ+2)
  10050  f508					      endif
  10051  f508
  10052  f508				  -	      ifconst	EXTRADLMEMORY
  10053  f508				  -SECONDDLHALFSTART SET	$2300
  10054  f508					      endif
  10055  f508
  10056  f508				   DLPOINTH
  10057  f508				   DLINDEX    SET	0
  10058  f508					      REPEAT	WZONECOUNT
  10059  f508				   TMPMEMADDRESS SET	(((DLINDEX*WMEMSIZE)/WZONECOUNT)+WDLMEMSTART)
  10060  f508				  -	      ifconst	EXTRADLMEMORY
  10061  f508				  -	      if	TMPMEMADDRESS > $1FFF
  10062  f508				  -TMPMEMADDRESS SET	(TMPMEMADDRESS + $300)
  10063  f508				  -	      else
  10064  f508				  -	      if	((((DLINDEX+1)*WMEMSIZE)/WZONECOUNT)+WDLMEMSTART) > $1FFF
  10065  f508				  -TMPMEMADDRESS SET	(TMPMEMADDRESS + $300)
  10066  f508				  -SECONDDLHALFSTART SET	TMPMEMADDRESS
  10067  f508				  -	      endif
  10068  f508				  -	      endif		; TMPMEMADDRESS > $1FFF
  10069  f508					      endif		; EXTRADLMEMORY
  10070  f508							;echo " "," ZONE",[DLINDEX]d,"ADDRESS: ",TMPMEMADDRESS
  10071  f508		       18		      .byte.b	>TMPMEMADDRESS
  10072  f508				   DLINDEX    SET	DLINDEX + 1
  10058  f508					      REPEND
  10059  f508				   TMPMEMADDRESS SET	(((DLINDEX*WMEMSIZE)/WZONECOUNT)+WDLMEMSTART)
  10060  f509				  -	      ifconst	EXTRADLMEMORY
  10061  f509				  -	      if	TMPMEMADDRESS > $1FFF
  10062  f509				  -TMPMEMADDRESS SET	(TMPMEMADDRESS + $300)
  10063  f509				  -	      else
  10064  f509				  -	      if	((((DLINDEX+1)*WMEMSIZE)/WZONECOUNT)+WDLMEMSTART) > $1FFF
  10065  f509				  -TMPMEMADDRESS SET	(TMPMEMADDRESS + $300)
  10066  f509				  -SECONDDLHALFSTART SET	TMPMEMADDRESS
  10067  f509				  -	      endif
  10068  f509				  -	      endif		; TMPMEMADDRESS > $1FFF
  10069  f509					      endif		; EXTRADLMEMORY
  10070  f509							;echo " "," ZONE",[DLINDEX]d,"ADDRESS: ",TMPMEMADDRESS
  10071  f509		       19		      .byte.b	>TMPMEMADDRESS
  10072  f509				   DLINDEX    SET	DLINDEX + 1
  10058  f509					      REPEND
  10059  f509				   TMPMEMADDRESS SET	(((DLINDEX*WMEMSIZE)/WZONECOUNT)+WDLMEMSTART)
  10060  f50a				  -	      ifconst	EXTRADLMEMORY
  10061  f50a				  -	      if	TMPMEMADDRESS > $1FFF
  10062  f50a				  -TMPMEMADDRESS SET	(TMPMEMADDRESS + $300)
  10063  f50a				  -	      else
  10064  f50a				  -	      if	((((DLINDEX+1)*WMEMSIZE)/WZONECOUNT)+WDLMEMSTART) > $1FFF
  10065  f50a				  -TMPMEMADDRESS SET	(TMPMEMADDRESS + $300)
  10066  f50a				  -SECONDDLHALFSTART SET	TMPMEMADDRESS
  10067  f50a				  -	      endif
  10068  f50a				  -	      endif		; TMPMEMADDRESS > $1FFF
  10069  f50a					      endif		; EXTRADLMEMORY
  10070  f50a							;echo " "," ZONE",[DLINDEX]d,"ADDRESS: ",TMPMEMADDRESS
  10071  f50a		       19		      .byte.b	>TMPMEMADDRESS
  10072  f50a				   DLINDEX    SET	DLINDEX + 1
  10058  f50a					      REPEND
  10059  f50a				   TMPMEMADDRESS SET	(((DLINDEX*WMEMSIZE)/WZONECOUNT)+WDLMEMSTART)
  10060  f50b				  -	      ifconst	EXTRADLMEMORY
  10061  f50b				  -	      if	TMPMEMADDRESS > $1FFF
  10062  f50b				  -TMPMEMADDRESS SET	(TMPMEMADDRESS + $300)
  10063  f50b				  -	      else
  10064  f50b				  -	      if	((((DLINDEX+1)*WMEMSIZE)/WZONECOUNT)+WDLMEMSTART) > $1FFF
  10065  f50b				  -TMPMEMADDRESS SET	(TMPMEMADDRESS + $300)
  10066  f50b				  -SECONDDLHALFSTART SET	TMPMEMADDRESS

  10106  f520				  -TMPMEMADDRESS SET	(TMPMEMADDRESS + $300)
  10107  f520				  -	      endif
  10108  f520				  -	      endif		; TMPMEMADDRESS > $1FFF
  10109  f520					      endif		; EXTRADLMEMORY

     $1880 to $1fff used as zone memory, allowing 31 display objects per zone.
  10118  f520					      echo	"   ",[WDLMEMSTART],"to",[WDLMEMEND],"used as zone memory, allowing",[(DLLASTOBJ/5)]d,"display objects per zone."

  10120  f520				   DLHEIGHT
  10121  f520					      REPEAT	WZONECOUNT
  10122  f520		       0f		      .byte.b	(WZONEHEIGHT-1)
  10121  f520					      REPEND
  10122  f521		       0f		      .byte.b	(WZONEHEIGHT-1)
  10121  f521					      REPEND
  10122  f522		       0f		      .byte.b	(WZONEHEIGHT-1)
  10121  f522					      REPEND

  10121  f523					      REPEND

  10121  f524					      REPEND

  10121  f525					      REPEND

  10121  f527					      REPEND

  10121  f528					      REPEND

  10121  f529					      REPEND

  10121  f52a					      REPEND
  10122  f52b		       0f		      .byte.b	(WZONEHEIGHT-1)
  10123  f52c					      REPEND
  10124  f52c
  10125  f52c							; Provided under the CC0 license. See the included LICENSE.txt for details.
  10126  f52c
  10127  f52c							; a simple guard, than ensures the 7800basic code hasn't
  10128  f52c							; spilled into the encryption area...
     2642 bytes left in the 7800basic reserved area.
  10129  f52c					      echo	"   ",($FF7E-*)d,"bytes left in the 7800basic reserved area."
  10130  f52c				  -	      if	(*>$FF7D)
  10131  f52c				  -	      echo
  10132  f52c				  -	      echo	"***************************"
  10133  f52c				  -	      echo	"*** Abort: ROM Overflow ***"
  10134  f52c				  -	      echo	"***************************"
  10135  f52c				  -	      ERR		; abort the assembly
  10136  f52c					      endif
  10137  f52c
  10138  f52c							; throw a compile
  10139  f52c				  -	      ifconst	RMT
  10140  f52c				  -	      ifnconst	pokeysupport
  10141  f52c				  -	      echo
  10142  f52c				  -	      echo	"************************************************************"
  10143  f52c				  -	      echo	"*** ABORT: RMT Tracker requires 'set pokeysupport $xxxx' ***"
  10144  f52c				  -	      echo	"************************************************************"
  10145  f52c				  -	      ERR		; abort
  10146  f52c				  -	      endif		; pokeysupport
  10147  f52c				  -	      ifnconst	pokeyaddress
  10148  f52c				  -	      echo
  10149  f52c				  -	      echo	"************************************************************"
  10150  f52c				  -	      echo	"*** ABORT: RMT Tracker requires 'set pokeysupport $xxxx' ***"
  10151  f52c				  -	      echo	"************************************************************"
  10152  f52c				  -	      ERR		; abort
  10153  f52c				  -	      endif		; pokeyaddress
  10154  f52c					      endif
  10155  f52c
  10156  f52c							; Provided under the CC0 license. See the included LICENSE.txt for details.
  10157  f52c
  10158  f52c				  -	      ifconst	DEV
  10159  f52c				  -	      ifnconst	ZONEHEIGHT
  10160  f52c				  -	      echo	"* the 4k 7800basic area has",[($FF7E - *)]d,"bytes free."
  10161  f52c				  -	      else
  10162  f52c				  -	      if	ZONEHEIGHT = 8
  10163  f52c				  -	      echo	"* the 4k 7800basic area has",[($FF7E - *)]d,"bytes free."
  10164  f52c				  -	      else
  10165  f52c				  -	      echo	"* the 4k 7800basic area has",[($FF7E - *)]d,"bytes free."
  10166  f52c				  -	      endif
  10167  f52c				  -	      endif
  10168  f52c					      endif
  10169  f52c
  10170  f52c				  -	      if	START_OF_ROM = .
  10171  f52c				  -	      .byte	0
  10172  f52c					      endif
  10173  f52c				   START_OF_ROM SET	0
  10174  f52c
  10175  f52c							; FF7E/FF7F contains the 7800basic crc checksum word
  10176  f52c
  10177  f52c							; FF80 - FFF7 contains the 7800 encryption key
  10178  f52c
  10179  f52c					      ifnconst	bankswitchmode
  10180  fff8					      ORG	$FFF8
  10181  fff8				  -	      else
  10182  fff8				  -	      ifconst	ROM128K
  10183  fff8				  -	      ORG	$27FF8
  10184  fff8				  -	      RORG	$FFF8
  10185  fff8				  -	      endif
  10186  fff8				  -	      ifconst	ROM144K
  10187  fff8				  -	      ORG	$27FF8
  10188  fff8				  -	      RORG	$FFF8
  10189  fff8				  -	      endif
  10190  fff8				  -	      ifconst	ROM256K
  10191  fff8				  -	      ORG	$47FF8
  10192  fff8				  -	      RORG	$FFF8
  10193  fff8				  -	      endif
  10194  fff8				  -	      ifconst	ROM272K
  10195  fff8				  -	      ORG	$47FF8
  10196  fff8				  -	      RORG	$FFF8
  10197  fff8				  -	      endif
  10198  fff8				  -	      ifconst	ROM512K
  10199  fff8				  -	      ORG	$87FF8
  10200  fff8				  -	      RORG	$FFF8
  10201  fff8				  -	      endif
  10202  fff8				  -	      ifconst	ROM528K
  10203  fff8				  -	      ORG	$87FF8
  10204  fff8				  -	      RORG	$FFF8
  10205  fff8				  -	      endif
  10206  fff8					      endif
  10207  fff8
  10208  fff8
  10209  fff8		       ff		      .byte.b	$FF	; region verification. $FF=all regions
  10210  fff9		       f7		      .byte.b	$F7	; high nibble:  encryption check from $N000 to $FF7F. we only hash the last 4k for faster boot.
  10211  fffa							; low nibble :  N=7 atari rainbow start, N=3 no atari rainbow
  10212  fffa
  10213  fffa							;Vectors
  10214  fffa		       00 f0		      .word.w	NMI
  10215  fffc		       8a f4		      .word.w	START
  10216  fffe		       5f f0		      .word.w	IRQ
  10217  10000
